title: Making Script Patterns With CorelDraw
headline: This free online course covers the essentials of script patterns and CorelDraw for improving your tattoo art skills.
description: This script pattern course provides a comprehensive guide to making colourful patterns for tattoos. You will learn the basics of CorelDraw in the design of script motifs, including how to use scripts and fonts in the creation of patterns. Discover how to make advanced designs using the ‘swastika base’, an ancient symbol representing spirituality and divinity, and plan out cutting-edge artistic concepts for use in the graphic design studio.
courseDescription:
Did you know that graphic designers can create stunning works of art using script patterns? Discover these essentials, taught by famed tattoo artist Lily Lu, by learning about psychedelic art composition and exploring the intricacies of CorelDraw using vector programming and identification of different pattern shapes. Do you know the difference between patterns and scripts and what the combination of both can do for your design? Analyse the step-by-step process of selecting scripts from CorelDraw dropdown and learn how to convert some to vector, consequently making a wonderful design.

The course then explains the make-up of vector graphics as lines and dots. Understand the functions of the wireframe under the ‘view’ options in CorelDraw. This course will teach you about what happens when you change from wireframes to Heinz during your design. You will learn how to make different designs using the drawing tools including how to separate your words and apply different graphics to them. Differentiate between the functions of a font and a script while designing. This course will further explain the functions of ‘helping lines’ in keeping your design in shape. You will also understand what to do with vectors at different stages of your creation. Examine how to play with your fonts as you group and ungroup your words, including how to make two letters become one in CorelDraw.

Finally, explore the usage of ‘straight script’ patterns along with their application to graphic design. Delve further into the usage of these patterns by playing with the options available, such as the arrow function and other tools in vector programming, and make advanced designs such as the ninety degrees swastika, the ancient symbol representing spirituality and divinity, using swastika-base patterns. You will also be able to recall the step-by-step processes involved in creating this design in CorelDraw using vectors. Enrol today to learn tips and hacks to employ when designing the perfect script pattern with CorelDraw.
